docs.lead_paragraph: WINTER HAVEN, Fla. EXCEPT for The Wall, three things have dominated left field in Boston's Fenway Park for the last 45 years: Ted Williams, Carl Yastrzemski and Jim Rice. And, except for extravagant talent, they have shared one thing: the personal wall standing between them and the critical public and press of the Red Sox. ''They got Ted,'' says Rice, meaning the snipers. ''They got Yaz. They got me.'' He is asked to explain, and says: ''Ted was a legend, and Yaz had a hard time taking his position. Yaz had to do something Ted didn't. Then Yaz was a legend, and I had a hard time taking his position. Now, I have to do something Yaz didn't.''

docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, May 23 (AP)-Sale of the Boston Red Sox for $20.5 million-- probably the most ever paid for a major league baseball team--was approved unanimously today by the American League owners.

docs.lead_paragraph: John Farrell left Boston after the 2010 season, leaving behind  two starters who seemed ready to enter their prime. In his absence, the two — Jon Lester and Clay Buchholz — lost their way.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes that when John Farrell left Boston Red Sox as pitching coach after 2010 season, team's two promising starters John Lester and Clay Buchholz lost their way.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bobby Valentine was 69-93, hindered by injuries and a midseason trade of high-salaried players after taking over a club that collapsed the previous September.

byline.original: By DAVID WALDSTEIN and ZACH SCHONBRUN

docs.lead_paragraph: The Red Sox gave Manager Bobby Valentine a two-year contract, a short-term commitment that stamped him with a win-or-else directive — and a flawed roster.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds that the Boston Red Sox hired manager Bobby Valentine to win games, but saddled him with a flawed roster without the tools to do so.
docs.snippet: The Red Sox gave Manager Bobby Valentine a two-year contract, a short-term commitment that stamped him with a win-or-else directive — and a flawed roster....

headline.main: Valentine, Hired to Win, Is Missing Tools to Do So
